<<<api>>>: Activity.setContentView
<<<code>>>: 
@Override
public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
    super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
    setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);
    mediaPlayer = new MediaPlayer();
    try {
        playSound(R.raw.b);
    } catch (IOException e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
}

private void playSound(int resId) throws IOException {
    if(mediaPlayer.isPlaying()) {
        mediaPlayer.stop();
    }
    mediaPlayer.reset();
    AssetFileDescriptor afd = getResources().openRawResourceFd(resId);
    if (afd != null) {
        mediaPlayer.setDataSource(afd.getFileDescriptor(), afd.getStartOffset(), afd.getLength());
        afd.close();
        mediaPlayer.prepare();
        mediaPlayer.start();
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The setContentView method is used to set the layout for the activity. The MediaPlayer object is initialized in the onCreate method. The playSound method is used to play the sound. It first checks if the MediaPlayer is already playing a sound, if it is, it stops the current sound. Then it resets the MediaPlayer and sets the data source to the sound file specified by the resId parameter. It then prepares the MediaPlayer and starts playing the sound. The playSound method is called in the onCreate method. If there is an IOException, it is caught and the stack trace is printed.
